s.text: As it waits to learn the fate of its contaminated office building across from the World Trade Center, the Legal Aid Society has turned its attention to a new home for its Harlem neighborhood division.
Theresa de Leon, Legal Aid's chief operating officer, said as the agency searched for new office space, it learned that buying a building would be less expensive than renting one.

Greenberg said it had already raised $7 million, mostly from law firms on its board and individual benefactors.
